events.name: Maker Immersion camp 2016
events.description:
Registrations for the five-day annual maker immersion camp is now open. From Nov 28 2016 to Dec 2 2016, students aged 10-14 will get a chance to get their hands dirty and work together on a project, at the same time picking up maker skills such as tool usage, digital fabrication, electronics and more. The programme will be peppered with fun workshops and a chance to fabricate with the mobile fablab - an exciting collaboration between SUTD, DSO and Science Centre. Cost: $225 per child, including refreshments Register at https://www.regonline.sg/2016camp

Tentative programme is as follows:
Day 1 AM: Welcome, Brief, Challenge Introduction, Challenge Pitch  
Day 1 PM: Campers choose workshops relevant to their chosen challenge. Each camper chooses two workshops. Tentative workshops include:
DC motors, Sewing with electronics, Basic Arduino, Urban farming
Day 2 AM: Run 2 of workshops. 
Day 2 PM: Quick intro to digital fabrication for kids. Campers counterpropose their own projects (subject to approval by facilitators
Day 3: Protoyping
Day 4: prototyping
Day 5: Finalize project prototypes and documentation. Debrief and presentation.
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road 609081
